meanings.definition: The side or part of an object that faces forward or is most often seen
meanings.sent1: The front of the house had a beautiful garden.
meanings.sent2: She stood at the front of the line to buy tickets.
meanings.sent3: The cat sat at the front of the window, watching the birds outside.
meanings.sent4: The front of the book had an intriguing illustration that caught my eye.
meanings.sent5: The bright red door at the front of the building made it easy to spot.

meanings.definition: The foremost part or surface of something
meanings.sent1: The front of the car was dented in the accident.
meanings.sent2: The front of the classroom is where the teacher's desk is placed.
meanings.sent3: The front of the cake was decorated with colorful frosting.
meanings.sent4: The front of the stage was lit up with bright lights for the performance.
meanings.sent5: The front of the line was filled with eager customers waiting to enter the store.

meanings.definition: The position directly ahead of someone or something
meanings.sent1: The car in front suddenly stopped, causing a traffic jam.
meanings.sent2: He always likes to sit in the front during movie screenings.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel ran to the front of the tree to hide its acorns.
meanings.sent4: The front of the race was filled with competitive runners.
meanings.sent5: The front of the line moved quickly as people entered the theater.

meanings.definition: To face forward or be positioned at the front of something
meanings.sent1: Please front the camera so we can take a picture.
meanings.sent2: The singer will front the band during the concert.
meanings.sent3: He decided to front the group in the upcoming presentation.
meanings.sent4: She will front the project team in the meeting tomorrow.
meanings.sent5: The captain will front the team in the championship game.
